basic_data.name: Edge Walk at the CN Tower

description: EdgeWalk is the "World's Highest External Walk on a Building" (Guinness World Record), a full circle hands-free walk on a 5 ft (1.5 m) wide ledge encircling the top of the Tower's main pod. Visitors walk in groups of six, while attached to an overhead safety rail via a trolley and harness system. Trained EdgeWalk guides encourage participants to push their personal limits, allowing them to lean back over Toronto with nothing but air and breathtaking views of Lake Ontario beneath them. Designed with the highest international safety and security standards in mind, EdgeWalk runs 1.5 hours, with the outdoor walk lasting approximately 30 minutes. Tickets include a keepsake video, photos and certificate of achievement. Participants also receive a CN Tower re-admission General Admission ticket + SkyPod (includes access to LookOut, Glass Floor/outdoor SkyTerrace, SkyPod Levels). EdgeWalk operates seasonally from spring to late fall, 7 days a week, and hours of operation fluctuate depending on daylight.

But earlier this year, I ended up walking on the edge of the tallest free-standing structure in the Western Hemisphere.
All thanks to the amazing staff at Edge Walk for making this an experience of a lifetime!
P.S. Thank you, Abdel and Paul! If you read this, I want you to know you guys are the most awesome people!
And whenever I'm back in Toronto I would love to experience the Edge Walk again with you all!

reviews.title: Breathtaking Views! A must for those with a strong stomach and courage!
text: I have done various excursions and adventures ranging from helicopter rides, skydiving, and traversing small waterfalls....but this was simply another level. The views and experience from 1100ft above downtown Toronto were well worth the price and were utterly breathtaking. The crew from the check-in staff the the team that guide you onto the Edge Walk (SHOUT OUT TO ROCKY FOR THE EXCELLENT PHOTOS AND ENCOURAGEMENT!!!), were all amazing. I would do this again in the heartbeat. It created memories to last a life time.

Side note: I left my ticket for my next activity at the check-in desk and did not realize I left it inside until after I left. I called and was helped by "Katie with a K". She said she would look for it. I grabbed lunch and within a half an hour Katie had found my ticket and saved me the headache and heartbreak of having to repurchase a new ticket. She didn't have to do that but she did. I promised I would make her "Trip Advisor Famous". Here is hoping she sees this! Thanks Katie.

reviews.title: Amazing view!
text: I went here with my dad and brother - we all had an amazing time!  Seeing the city from so high up was awesome; I recommend that you familiarize yourself with Toronto's layout beforehand so that you can see what landmarks you can spot.

The guide was very helpful, cheerful, and informative.  She walked us through all of the stunts, encouraged people who were hesitant, and had plenty of interesting facts about the view.  (Check out the roof of the aquarium and admire the sharks painted there!)
I felt perfectly safe: the staff checked our gear multiple times and told us what every piece of equipment was for.  They supply raincoats if needed.
The ticket also includes access to both viewing levels, which was a nice bonus, even though the view wasn't nearly as impressive as the one from the walk.  :)
Head's up that the video is included in the ticket, but photos cost extra.  They didn't give us a group discount, so we each paid for our photo packages and most of the photos appeared in all three.
If you live in the area, it's definitely worth checking out.  And if you're from out of town, it's a great chance to see the entire city in one shot.  :D

reviews.title: 100% worth it!
text: Our experience was very smooth throughout. I went with my family (our ages range from 22-60). I'd suggest this activity for anyone visiting Toronto for the first time AND for people who have visited/lived in the city and haven't seen the city from this point of view. I'd like to give a special shoutout to Steven and Katie who made sure we were excited from the get go to the very end. I loved how they made sure we were safe by checking on our harnesses not just once but approximately 4-5 times. There were "activities" to do while on the Edge Walk and all the instructions were conveyed by Steven so well, it made our experience 10/10. Another thing I liked was that once you buy Edge Walk tickets, you are given access to the main observatory deck as well as the Skypod situated on the very top of the tower.
Tip: If you are going during fall (or anytime other than summer haha) make sure you get a slot for the day so that you can view the whole city and Lake Ontario clearly!
P.S. Steven made our experience 11/10. Loved his vibes and professionalism! The happiest person who loves his job and meeting new people :)

reviews.title: Amazing experience!!!
text: What a unique experience! Stepping outside and walking along the edge at the top of the CNTower was amazing! A video  and two pictures are included in the package which will serve as great memories of our experience. The Edgewalk ticket is also valid for a regular entrance to the CN Tower (up to the glass floor and Skypod) within two days. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Conquer your fear with a one-of-a-kind experience!
text: We went as a couple along with a friend, and due to traffic and circumstances we needed as much buffer time as possible, right up until the very last moment they would allow us to enter and begin. The Edgewalk team was accommodating and understanding, and we got in just in time, so we thank them profusely for how they were right off the bat-- before we'd even begun! Then as we began to suit up and get going, it became obvious how the experience and knowledge they had was giving us all the comfort and encouragement needed for any fears or jitters. Our guide was a superb young lady who helped make the time up there so much fun, often helping us forget our fears (at least for a few moments at time!).

We felt as safe as it can get; their process is rigorous, the suits, harnesses, and cables system is no joke. You will be tested by multiple team members, and they go the extra mile to ensure everyone is made to feel fully confident in every aspect before even entering the elevator to go up.

Also, we'd like to mention that you receive a video of your group's Edgewalk, as well as a couple photos, and you can purchase the full pictures which are very reasonably priced. You'd expect to be gouged, but this is not the case, so that topped off the whole thing.
100% recommended for anyone who is interested in one of the most unique experiences you can have, creating a memory to last a lifetime!
